instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15” Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no internal display
threads.message: [SIZE=12px]i have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that came in for no power, after diag realized its powering on fully just no internal display, checked <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> and realized it was 0, repaired and got screen for about 30 seconds, then black. figured out after a few seconds i lost [/SIZE]<SIGNAL>PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD_ISNS</SIGNAL>, so i jumped it from pin 2 to pin 5 of <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> and no more loss of display after a few seconds, leading me to believe <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> is bad, question is do i have to replace it, what harm will just jumping it do. i dont have a donor board for this board so if i have to replace it for some reason where can i get this chip?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no internal display
threads.message: Did you already touch up the soldering on <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no internal display
threads.message: no i touched up all the solder joints on <CHIP>U9000</CHIP>, i just touched up <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> even tho it looked fine and its lasting longer than 20 seconds this time, "jumper removed ofc" so i guess i had a bad solder joint, but i wounder would my jumper have caused any issues?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no internal display
threads.message: No <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>’s joints cracking is the signature fault of the 3332 board. Typically that fixes the video issues on it. Likely no issue with jumper or <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> at all.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no internal display
threads.message: Give <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> a proper reflow. Touching up the contacts will only last a few weeks/months.
